channel.title: What is your preferred forum software?
channel.description:
I've been trying to start up a forum, I've been working on images mostly, and some content, but I was wondering, what forum software do you prefer and why?
Me personally, I prefer SMF because it is what I'm used to, I tried one other one (Phpbb?), and I didn't really get it, I might try it again though.

item.title: What is your preferred forum software?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

PHPmyBB is something I’ve used a lot in the past. I haven’t used SMF much but it seems really good.
Free software wise those two are the best that I know off. I’m not sure about paid, vB is good but confusing allegedly though.

Read full topic
item.source: What is your preferred forum software?

item.title: What is your preferred forum software?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I prefer SMF as I can edit the PHP code to have multiple forums run on a split database if chose. Even went as far as having shared groups with separate permissions per forum lol.

Read full topic
item.source: What is your preferred forum software?

item.title: What is your preferred forum software?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

If I ever create a forum for a particular subject, it’s 9/10 times SMF. I’m just used to it and haven’t looked into anything much past phpBB.

Read full topic
item.source: What is your preferred forum software?

item.title: What is your preferred forum software?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I like Mybb, but you have to get a good theme for it.

Read full topic
item.source: What is your preferred forum software?

item.title: What is your preferred forum software?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

SMF is unmatched by any other forum software in my opinion, it has a bad past of glitches and bugs etc but the majority of them were wiped in the 2.0 installation and the other known bugs have been ironed out since then. People think that just because SMF is free vB and IPB must be better softwares, no. They are more noob-friendly but if you know basic PHP you can do anything either of those softwares do and often faster. SMF also offers the SSI, something that is unmatched by any other forum software.

Read full topic
item.source: What is your preferred forum software?

item.title: What is your preferred forum software?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Phpbb3 is alright, it just takes some time to get used to.

Read full topic
item.source: What is your preferred forum software?

item.title: What is your preferred forum software?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

iCreatedHorror:

SMF, as it’s free and there is a decent amount of support to be found within their community and elsewhere.

That is true. And as far as I know, SMF is one of the most popular ones, so it has a lot of mods that you can add to it.

Read full topic
